page.title: 17Village Services
page.content: Policing of Catthorpe and the surrounding villages is done by one policeman who is stationed in Lutterworth.The last time Catthorpe had it's own policeman was 10 years ago and he lived in Swinford. Because Catthorpe is a small village everybody knows everybody else,so few crimes are commited. The people of the village get regular visits from the policeman, although they never know when he is going to come.It has been found that adopting a friendly approach to the villagers,reduces the problems of policing,resulting in an average crime rate of 6-7 a year. The village is visited once a fortnight by a mobile library. There is a bus service 3 times a week from Rugby and once a day from Lutterworth (except Sunday.)
